greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of partitions of n having k parts with odd multiplicities.
comment: Row sums give A000041. - _Omar E. Pol_, Nov 21 2015
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..1000, flattened
formula: Sum_{k>0} k * T(n,k) = A209423(n). - _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 05 2020
example: T(6,1) = 4 because we have [6*], [4*,1,1],[2*,2,2], and [2*,1,1,1,1] (parts with odd multiplicities are marked).
maple: g := product((1+t*x^j)/(1-x^(2*j)), j = 1 .. 100): gser := simplify(series(g, x = 0, 30)): for n from 0 to 28 do P[n] := sort(coeff(gser, x, n)) end do: for n from 0 to 23 do seq(coeff(P[n], t, j), j = 0 .. degree(P[n])) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n==0, 1, If[i<1, 0, Sum[Expand[If[OddQ[j], x, 1]* b[n-i*j, i-1]], {j, 0, n/i}]]]; T[n_] := Function[p, Table[Coefficient[ p, x, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]][b[n, n]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 20}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 18 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Nov 21 2015
